alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Greenwood County through 230 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Greenwood, or 6 miles southwest of Ninety Six Historic Site, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ninety Six, Lake Greenwood State Park, Greenwood State Park, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Greenwood, Kirksey, Dyson, Callison and Epworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
